text: A great little place to get sushi and poke bowls! The dynamite roll was one of the best I've ever tried. It was so good I had to order one for takeout as well. Definitely did not disappoint!
The salmon teriyaki was literally cooked by wrapping it in plastic wrap and microwaving it for 2 minutes. Needless to say it tasted terrible.
Great new sushi place in Kensington Market with very fresh ingredients, reasonable pricing, and friendly staff. Highly recommend if you're in the area!
New spot for sushi in Kensington market. Not much seating but they have takeout. Lots of tasty colourful options

This new spot in Kensington Market offers good sushi at a reasonable price. They have a variety of rolls on offer, as well as miso soup and other standard sushi-place offerings. They accept credit and debit cards as well.  One thing that is not apparent from the sidewalk is that they have a good selection of grab-and go sushi in the case directly in front of where all the sushi is prepared.  They also have seating for about 15-20 guests (max) in the back of the Restaurant. The seating is pretty bare bones, but for anyone who has eaten a meal in Kensington Market, finding a minimally comfortable, non-cramped place to sit in a restaurant is not an easy task.  I enjoyed my meal here. This is a worthwhile spot in Kensington Market that will hopefully survive the winter and become a long-term staple in the area.
I came in on a whim and was not disappointed the udon fowl and the pok√© bowl were some of the best I've had!
A great new addition to Kensington. The sushi is fresh, the staff are nice, the prices are reasonable, what's not to love. Wishing them the best of luck.
